Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hinnavin II (Hin II, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; JJsn)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: inhibition zone assay: More active against G- than G+ bacteria: Gram- (22.2-36.3 mm2): E. coli K12 or D21, E. cloacae KCTC2361, Gram+ (0.8-7.1 mm2): B. megaterium Bm11,  M. luteus KCTC1056. Fungi A. niger and C. albicans.Synergy:AMPs: It also showed synergistic inhibition of bacterial growth with lysozyme.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: pET32a(+) vector, fusion with Trx, affinity purification, enterokinase cleavage, yield: 210 mg active rhin/MSH from 800 ml culture (Bang et al., 2010.
Literature Information.Author: Yoe SM, Kang CS, Han SS, Bang IS2006
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol B Biochem Mol Biol. 2006 Jun;144(2):199-205
Literature Information.Title: Characterization and cDNA cloning of hinnavin II, a cecropin family antibacterial peptide from the cabbage butterfly, Artogeia rapae.
